title: 'The alpha dog in football' - Mbappe's magic upstages Messi at Nou Camp
description: Kylian Mbappe nets a sublime Champions League hat-trick for Paris St-Germain to upstage Barcelona's Lionel Messi on his own turf and draw comparisons with Brazilian Ronaldo.

title: Murmurations above supermarket 'wow' shoppers
description: The flock started to settle in trees near Asda, on Hall Road, Norwich at the weekend.

title: Asda: How to buy a £6.8bn supermarket for £780m
description: Asda has new owners - but they are borrowing £4bn to finance the deal. Will the debt burden be too great?

title: In pictures: The carnival that wasn't
description: Rio would normally be a riot of colour at this time of year, but carnival had to be postponed.

title: Zahawi: Domestic vaccine passports 'not in our planning'
description: But the UK's vaccine minister says certificates will be provided if people need them for international travel.

title: Burgh Island statue 'should be pilchards not pirates'
description: Pirates Anne Bonny and Mary Read broke gender boundaries - but "do not belong" on Burgh Island.

title: What to look out for in Champions League knockout stages
description: Home games being moved thousands of miles and former champions finding form as others enter a crisis, what you need to know about the Champions League knockout stages.

title: Myanmar coup: UN warns Myanmar junta of 'severe consequences'
description: The UN envoy says "the right of peaceful assembly must fully be respected", as protests continue.

title: The papers: 'Final lockdown?' and 'Royal soap Oprah'
description: Tuesday's papers report Boris Johnson's warning that England's current lockdown must be the last.

title: Covid in Scotland: Sturgeon set to confirm phased return to schools
description: The first minister has said she is "very keen" to proceed with a phased return to more normal schooling.

title: GB's Hewett & Reid win Australian Open wheelchair doubles title
description: Britons Alfie Hewett and Gordon Reid beat Stephane Houdet and Nicolas Peifer to defend their Australian Open men's wheelchair doubles title.

title: Osaka cruises into Australian Open semi-finals
description: Three-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka cruises past Hsieh Su-wei in just 66 minutes to reach the semi-finals of the Australian Open.

title: Students 'see the beauty in the ordinary'
description: First-year photography students at the University for the Creative Arts show off their work.

title: Covid: Rapid tests could help reopen nightclubs, PM suggests
description: Boris Johnson suggests testing clubbers and theatregoers to reopen venues that have been closed since March.

title: Sacked LGBT veterans can reclaim removed medals
description: Former military personnel dismissed because of their sexuality may apply to restore honours.

title: Free speech plan to tackle 'silencing' views on campus
description: New post is among proposals aimed at strengthening academic freedom in England's universities.

title: Could churches do more to fight climate change?
description: Some young Christians in the UK say they want to see more action in their own churches.

title: Yemen: The boy who saved his sister from a sniper
description: Ten-year-old Amri risked his life to save his sibling, but in Yemen others are not so lucky.

title: Full-face hot-wax TikTok videos prompt warnings
description: Skin experts raise health-and-safety concerns about the videos, which do not carry a warning.

title: Without music, will New Orleans survive?
description: Known as the birthplace of Jazz, New Orleans has thousands of musicians that rely on gigs to survive.

title: How Congo-Brazzaville's shark population came under threat
description: The shark population off Congo-Brazzaville is threatened as desperate fishermen search deeper waters.

title: Covid: Father and daughter to leave quarantine hotel after 'error'
description: The father and young daughter are told they can isolate at home, instead of staying in a hotel for 10 days.

title: The hypercar maker who was told to give up his dream
description: Mate Rimac struggled to get anyone to believe that cutting edge sportscars could be made in Croatia.

title: Covid: Ardrossan care worker caught virus twice and fears it could happen again
description: Care worker Michelle Lamont tested positive for coronavirus last April and then again in November.

title: Fake Amazon reviews 'being sold in bulk' online
description: A Which? investigation found 10 sites offering fake Amazon Marketplace reviews from as little as £5 each.

title: Optimism as Cuba set to test its own Covid vaccine
description: The first trials of the Cuban-produced Soberana 2 are "encouraging", Cuban scientists say.

title: 450,000 families ‘behind on rent because of Covid’
description: One in 20 private renters say they have been refused rent reductions, a report says.

title: 'My mum was an alcoholic and it was a massive secret'
description: Becky Ellis Hamilton's mum had an alcohol problem but no-one talked about it - and this had tragic consequences.
